verses.verse: And Sarah<WH8283> was an hundred<WH3967><WH8141> and seven<WH7651><WH8141> and twenty<WH6242> years<WH8141> old<WH2416>: these were the years<WH8141> of the life<WH2416> of Sarah<WH8283>.

And Sarah<WH8283> died<WH4191> in Kirjath-arba<WH7153>; the same is Hebron<WH2275> in the land<WH776> of Canaan<WH3667>: and Abraham<WH85> came<WH935> to mourn<WH5594> for Sarah<WH8283>, and to weep<WH1058> for her.
¶ And Abraham<WH85> stood up<WH6965> from before<WH6440> his dead<WH4191>, and spake<WH1696> unto the sons<WH1121> of Heth<WH2845>, saying<WH559>,
I am a stranger<WH1616> and a sojourner<WH8453> with you: give<WH5414> me a possession<WH272> of a buryingplace<WH6913> with you, that I may bury<WH6912> my dead<WH4191> out of my sight<WH6440>.
And the children<WH1121> of Heth<WH2845> answered<WH6030> Abraham<WH85>, saying<WH559> unto him,

Hear us<WH8085>, my lord<WH113>: thou art a mighty<WH430> prince<WH5387> among us<WH8432>: in the choice<WH4005> of our sepulchres<WH6913> bury<WH6912> thy dead<WH4191>; none<WH3808><WH376> of us shall withhold<WH3607> from thee his sepulchre<WH6913>, but that thou mayest bury<WH6912> thy dead<WH4191>.
And Abraham<WH85> stood up<WH6965>, and bowed<WH7812> himself to the people<WH5971> of the land<WH776>, even to the children<WH1121> of Heth<WH2845>.

And he communed<WH1696> with them, saying<WH559>, If it be<WH3426> your mind<WH5315> that I should bury<WH6912> my dead<WH4191> out of my sight<WH6440>; hear<WH8085> me, and intreat<WH6293> for me to Ephron<WH6085> the son<WH1121> of Zohar<WH6714>,

That he may give<WH5414> me the cave<WH4631> of Machpelah<WH4375>, which he hath, which is in the end<WH7097> of his field<WH7704>; for as much<WH4392> money<WH3701> as it is worth<WH4392> he shall give it<WH5414> me for a possession<WH272> of a buryingplace<WH6913> amongst you<WH8432>.

And Ephron<WH6085> dwelt<WH3427> among<WH8432> the children<WH1121> of Heth<WH2845>: and Ephron<WH6085> the Hittite<WH2850> answered<WH6030> Abraham<WH85> in the audience<WH241> of the children<WH1121> of Heth<WH2845>, even of all that went in<WH935> at the gate<WH8179> of his city<WH5892>, saying<WH559>,

Nay<WH3808>, my lord<WH113>, hear me<WH8085>: the field<WH7704> give I<WH5414> thee, and the cave<WH4631> that is therein, I give it<WH5414> thee; in the presence<WH5869> of the sons<WH1121> of my people<WH5971> give<WH5414> I it thee: bury<WH6912> thy dead<WH4191>.
And Abraham<WH85> bowed down<WH7812> himself before<WH6440> the people<WH5971> of the land<WH776>.

And he spake<WH1696> unto Ephron<WH6085> in the audience<WH241> of the people<WH5971> of the land<WH776>, saying<WH559>, But if thou wilt give it, I pray thee<WH3863>, hear<WH8085> me: I will give<WH5414> thee money<WH3701> for the field<WH7704>; take<WH3947> it of me, and I will bury<WH6912> my dead<WH4191> there.
And Ephron<WH6085> answered<WH6030> Abraham<WH85>, saying<WH559> unto him,

My lord<WH113>, hearken<WH8085> unto me: the land<WH776> is worth four<WH702> hundred<WH3967> shekels<WH8255> of silver<WH3701>; what is that betwixt<WH996> me and thee? bury<WH6912> therefore thy dead<WH4191>.

And Abraham<WH85> hearkened<WH8085> unto Ephron<WH6085>; and Abraham<WH85> weighed<WH8254> to Ephron<WH6085> the silver<WH3701>, which he had named<WH1696> in the audience<WH241> of the sons<WH1121> of Heth<WH2845>, four<WH702> hundred<WH3967> shekels<WH8255> of silver<WH3701>, current<WH5674> money with the merchant<WH5503>.

¶ And the field<WH7704> of Ephron<WH6085>, which was in Machpelah<WH4375>, which was before<WH6440> Mamre<WH4471>, the field<WH7704>, and the cave<WH4631> which was therein, and all the trees<WH6086> that were in the field<WH7704>, that were in all the borders<WH1366> round about<WH5439>, were made sure<WH6965>
Unto Abraham<WH85> for a possession<WH4736> in the presence<WH5869> of the children<WH1121> of Heth<WH2845>, before all that went in<WH935> at the gate<WH8179> of his city<WH5892>.

And after<WH310> this<WH3651>, Abraham<WH85> buried<WH6912> Sarah<WH8283> his wife<WH802> in the cave<WH4631> of the field<WH7704> of Machpelah<WH4375> before<WH6440> Mamre<WH4471>: the same is Hebron<WH2275> in the land<WH776> of Canaan<WH3667>.
And the field<WH7704>, and the cave<WH4631> that is therein, were made sure<WH6965> unto Abraham<WH85> for a possession<WH272> of a buryingplace<WH6913> by the sons<WH1121> of Heth<WH2845>.
